Detailed Description

Describes one node on one street segment.

Including a list with all connections that leads from this node. A node is one of the endpoints of a OldStreetSegmentItem (is the street segment not i a stright line from node 0 to node 1 it might have graphical points in between, but these are not nodes and described by the GfxData for the OldStreetSegmentItem). The connections that are used when traversing the map is always between two OldNodes.

A node have membervariables that is valid for the streetsegment when entering the road at that node (e.g. entry restrictions or level).

Definition at line 48 of file OldNode.h.

bool OldNode::addConnection (  OldConnection *  newCon,
OldGenericMap &  theMap
) 
 

Add one connection to this node.

Parameters:
newCon The new connection that will be added. NB!No copying is made, so the new connection must not be deleted.
Returns:
True if the connection is added, false otherwise (the connection from the specified node does already exist).

void OldNode::addLaneConnectivity (  OldGenericMap &  theMap,
uint32  fromNodeID,
uint32  fromLaneIndex
) 
 

Add another connecting lane to the ones stored for the connection from fromNodeID to this node.

This does not remove any existing connecting lanes, and if the fromLaneIndex is already set as a connecting lane, the data is not changed.

bool OldNode::addSignPostPart (  OldGenericMap &  theMap,
uint32  fromNodeID,
uint32  signPostIndex,
uint32  singPostSetIdx,
uint32  signPostPartIdx,
GMSSignPostElm &  singPostElm
) 
 

Adds a sign post part valid for the connection from fromNodeID.

If no connection between this node and fromNodeID, no sign post data is added. If this sign post set is already set, it is not set again.

Parameters:
theMap The map to add the sign post data to
fromNodeID The node from which the connection of this sign post data comes.
signPostIndex The index of this sign post. There may be many sign posts stored for the same connection.
singPostSetIdx The sign post set to add the sign post data to.
signPostPartIdx The sign post part within the set to add the signpost data to.
singPostElm The sign post data to add.
Returns:
Returns false of no sign post data was added.

void OldNode::completeLaneInfoFromGdf (  OldGenericMap &  theMap  ) 
 

Method used by GDF extraction.

Can only be called once for a lane. Reorders lanes so they are indexed from left to right etc.

uint32 OldNode::getConnectedLanes (  const OldGenericMap &  theMap,
uint32  fromNodeID
)  const
 

Returns:
Returns a bit field with the lanes of the from node that connects to this node. Lowest bit is representing the left most lane. If no data about this connection exists, MAX_UINT32 is returned.

uint32 OldNode::getNodeID (   )  const [inline]
 

Get the ID of this node.

The ID is the same as the ID for the Street Segment where this node is located except the MSB (that is 1 if this is node 1, 0 otherwise).

Returns:
The id of this node

bool OldNode::updateNodeAttributesFromNode (  OldNode *  otherNode,
uint32  nodeNbr,
bool  sameMap = true
) 
 

Method that updates all attributes of a node to the values of another node.

This includes e.g. entry restrictions, speed limits and major road attributes. If the nodes are originating from the same map (same node) also the attributes of the connections to the node are updated to values from otherNode. For more documentation see the updateAttributesFromItem method in OldItem.h.

Parameters:
otherNode The node from which to get update values.
nodeNbr The node nbr (0 or 1) of this node.
sameMap Default true meaning that the nodes are one and the same (same map), set to false if the they originates from different maps (e.g. underview and overview map)
Returns:
True if some attribute was updated for the connection, false if not.

int8 OldNode::m_level [protected]
 

Level of node relative groundlevel.

  1. ...; below ground
  2. -1; below ground
  3. 0; on ground
  4. 1; above ground
  5. ...; above ground

uint32 OldNode::m_nodeID [protected]
 

The id of this node.

The first bit indicates if this is node 0 or 1 in the OldStreetSegmentItem with id nodeID & 0x7FFFFFFF.
